Award.AbstractNarration: This award is made as part of the FY 2012 Mathematical Sciences Postdoctoral Research Fellowships Program. These fellowships support a research and training plan at a host institution in the mathematical sciences, including applications to other disciplines. The title of the research fellowship awarded to Elena Yudovina is "Applications of queueing theory." The host institution for the fellowship is University of Michigan, and the sponsoring scientist is Dr. George Michailidis.

Performance_Institution.Name: University of Michigan Department of Statistics

POR.DRECONTENT:
I was awarded the NSF Mathematical Sciences Postdoctoral Research Fellowship to pursue research in applied probability under the mentorship of George Michailidis at the University of Michigan. I pursued research at the University of Michigan for two years, during which time I co-authored two research papers and made substantial progress on a third project. The research covered a variety of applications of high-dimensional probability, ranging from an application of queueing theory to electric vehicle charging to an investigation of statistical estimation techniques in high-dimensional settings.

The research allowed me to interact not only with members of my host department of statistics, but also with the department of mathematics, leading to effective cross-fertilization. In addition, I spent several months volunteering at the Center for Statistics Consultation and Research, where I was able to assist members of the greater academic community at the University of Michigan with their statistical estimation. This in turn led me to a greater appreciation for the role of statistical research in other disciplines.

During my tenure at the University of MIchigan, I was able to present my work at several conferences and seminars, including INFORMS, a major conference for the mathematics of operations research and related disciplines. I was additionally able to use some of the travel funding to travel to New Zealand for the purposes of collaborating with Ilze Ziedins at the University of Auckland, as well as traveling to several universities to give seminar talks there.


Last Modified: 07/03/2016
Modified by: Elena Yudovina
